snippet: After a 13-year pause, Pakistan’s top court revived an investigation into alleged election rigging by the country’s main spy agency on Wednesday.
abstract: Pakistan’s top court revives an investigation into alleged election rigging by the country’s main spy agency after an unexplained 13-year pause; the Inter-Services Intelligence Directorate is accused of paying $6.5 million to a right-wing opposition alliance to influence the outcome of the 1990 election; case is potentially explosive in a country where the ISI has a history of meddling in politics.

byline.original: By SALMAN MASOOD and DECLAN WALSH

lead_paragraph: After a 13-year pause, Pakistan’s top court revived an investigation into alleged election rigging by the country’s main spy agency on Wednesday.

headline.seo: Pakistani Court Resurrects Election Tampering Investigation
headline.main: Pakistan’s High Court Resurrects Election Tampering Case
headline.print_headline: Pakistan’s High Court Resurrects Election Tampering Case
